We want to bestow blessings on them as we can. But there are times, very few times, that maybe their behavior prevents a blessing. We understand that humanly speaking, do we not? I want you to think about it spiritually. God is able to bless us abundantly. Let me say this.  blessed us abundantly. He has been so good to us, but I want you to think about the blessings that He has in store for us and ask ourselves the question, am I living a life that is blessable? Is God going to see fit to bless my life? Am I living in obedience to Him? Am I trusting Him? Am I following Him? Am I living pleasing in His life? Because our God is able to bless us abundantly. Again, He has blessed us beyond measure, but I wonder, are there some blessings that maybe I have forfeited because of my disobedience? Are there some blessings? I'm asking myself, but I'm inviting you to ask yourself. Are there some blessings that I have forfeited from the hand of my good God because of my disobedience? I think tonight if we'd all be honest, we'd say yes. There's some times in our lives that we've not been obedient to God and perhaps we've missed out on a blessing from God. I want to live in such a way that I am blessed and I am blessable. I can't manufacture God's blessing. I can try. You can try, but a manufactured blessing pales in comparison to the real thing. Amen? And I want God's blessing upon my life and I hope that you want it. I know that you do. You want God's blessing on your life. And so we must live lives that are blessable, that are pleasing to the Lord. Let's pray. Father, we love you. Thank you for loving us. As we think about the passage, we understand the historical context and all that's transpired. I thank you for the obedience of Jacob and responding to the instruction that's been given. And as we study the next several chapters and see all that has transpired in his life and your blessing, we know that he's not perfect and obviously there's plenty of problems that we've already pointed out in the life of Jacob, but in this instant we find that he responded in obedience. He departed as he was instructed to. Lord, I see the response of Esau and how sometimes we can maybe try to manufacture a blessing. And God, I pray that you'd help us to look at this passage and not only understand the historical context, but desire and purpose to live lives that are pleasing in your sight. That we'd be living and behaving in a manner in which is blessable by you. We thank you that you are so good to us. God, I pray that you'd move and work as only you can. For it's in Christ's name we pray. Would you stand with me? Heads are bowed, eyes are closed. We're gonna have just a brief moment of invitation this evening, give you an opportunity. Maybe you want to come and thank God for his blessings. Maybe you want to come and ask God to help you to live a life that is pleasing in his sight, that you would be blessable. God, I don't want to forfeit any blessings in my life. I don't want to try to manufacture blessings in my life. I want to live in obedience to your revealed will. As Kimberly plays, the altar is open.
